resources.string: Each player draws one card from the deck – highest card starts. When you’re ready, tap Continue.
Top card of pile: play same or lower to continue
Play selected cards or pick up pile

How to Play Swoop

  • On your turn, play one or more cards of the same rank, at or below the top of the discard pile.
  • If you can’t (or won’t), pick up the entire pile.
  • Tens and Jokers are “Swoop” cards: they clear the pile and let you go again.
  • You start with 4 face‑down, 4 face‑up, plus 11–12 in hand.
  • Face‑down cards only playable after their face‑up cover is gone.
  • First to empty their cards wins the round; lowest total score wins the game.

Official Game Rules

  1. Object: Discard all your cards each round; keep lowest score.
  2. Scoring:
    • Ace = 1 point
    • 2–9 = face value
    • J/Q/K = 10 points each
    • Ten & Joker = swoop value (25 or 50)
  3. Setup: 3 decks for 2–4 players; +1 deck per extra 2 players.
  4. Play: See Instructions above.
  5. Swoop Cards: Tens & Jokers instantly clear the pile.
  6. Face‑down Cards: Risky—flip to play, but higher means pickup.
  7. End Round: When someone goes out, score leftovers. First to limit (e.g. 500) loses.

Game Options

  1. Risk
    1. You may immediately play the face‑down card after playing the face‑up card on the same pile. If you played more than one face‑up card, each corresponding face‑down may be played in any order.
    2. After playing the first face‑down card, you may also play any additional cards from your hand (including piles) of the same rank or numeric value.
    3. You still retain the option to play further face‑down cards under their face‑up covers, keeping in mind the new pile top.
  2. Swoop card value can be set to 25 or 50. Setting it to 50 increases the risk.
  3. Game ending point total can be set to 300 or 500. Choosing 300 shortens the game and gives less recovery time.
